title: Visualize
text: Draw a diagram representing the situation.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Identify
text: Identify what you are solving for.

title: What Are You Solving For
text: You are solving for the time it takes the two drivers to become 325 miles apart.

title: Make a Variable
text: Create a variable to represent the time that it takes the drivers to become 325 miles apart. Let the variable be x.

title: Translate to Equation
text: Translate the situation into an equation using variable you named. Remeber that the time two trucks traveled are the same, but the directions are different, and the distance equals $$speed time$$.

title: The Equation
text: Multiply the speed of the drivers by the time to get that $$60x+70x=325$$ (since they are moving away from each other).

title: Solving the Equation
text: After solving the equation, what do you get for x?

subHints.title: Solving the Equation
subHints.text: To solve the equation $$60x+70x=325$$, we follow these steps: 60x+70x=325-->130x=325-->x=2.5.
